Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly, but may still show minor gaps or incomplete labeling)
CAN: The student can include different types of fish in their drawing and correctly label them.
The student can illustrate and label a specific habitat such as a pond, lake, river, or ocean where fish live.
The student can draw and label essential elements that fish need to survive, like water and possibly some plants.
The student may depict fish interacting with the water to show survival needs, like swimming.
The student may show plants or other animals present in the fish's habitat with appropriate labels.
CANNOT: The student might occasionally miss labeling certain elements, such as the interaction between fish and water. (e.g., water may be shown but not explicitly labeled)
The student could have minor inaccuracies, such as not fully representing how all elements interact as a system. (e.g., plants shown but not linked to how they benefit fish)
